speaker: Niles
text: Just the man I wanted to see.  Coffee, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: You would not believe the morning I...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, would you be terrible offended if I asked you just not to not talk about it and sit quietly?

speaker: Niles
text: Can I at least tell you...?

speaker: Frasier
text: Shhh, shhh, please, I do not have time for your folderol today.  I am meeting Charlotte for lunch and I'm planning my strategy on how to win her over.

speaker: Niles
text: I thought you said she has a boyfriend, this environmentalist fellow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Frank.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  So, what's your plan to get around him?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm merely going to present myself as the anti-Frank.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah.  So you're going to be not rugged and not handsome? Interesting.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: You're also going to be not passionate and not committed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very funny.

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe she'd like you if you were not interesting and not informed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Well you said my day was folderol!

speaker: Frasier
text: Sometimes it is!

speaker: Roz
text: I don't believe you.

speaker: Steve
text: It's true.  My roommate and I used to listen to your show Every day just for you.  We fell in love with your voice.

speaker: Roz
text: Really? [_in a dusky tone_] It's just a voice.

speaker: Steve
text: Well, all the guys on my floor listen to you.

speaker: Roz
text: To our show?

speaker: Steve
text: Yeah.

speaker: Roz
text: Boy, things sure have changed since I was in college.

speaker: Steve
text: Well, it wasn't exactly college, more like prison.

speaker: Roz
text: So was mine.  So where'd you go?

speaker: Steve
text: Prison.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh.  So... you fell in love with my voice?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Charlotte, hi.  You remember my brother Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Charlotte, how are you?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, hello.  Well, frustrated.  Been selling this guy all over town, but no one's buying.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting_] Well, perhaps if you threw in a toaster.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I just have to call Frank before we head out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, right.  So everything's settled between the two of you?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, yeah.  He came over last night, I don't even remember what we were fighting about.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what THAT means, don't you? [_sitting_] They had a long night of acrobatic make-up sex.

speaker: Niles
text: I just thought of another way you could be the anti-Frank.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm?

speaker: Frasier
text: Keep an eye out for her, will you?

speaker: Niles
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Research.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Frasier?  Foul play!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all is fair in love and war.  That's interesting.  An anthology of Irish plays.  Perfect!

speaker: Niles
text: What do you know about Irish plays?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing.  But not for long.  There's one area where no man has ever bested me, Niles: homework!

speaker: Frasier
text: Charlotte, listen, I was just beeped by a patient who's desperate to see me, so do you mind if we just switch lunch for dinner?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Actually, that's better for me.  I have four new clients coming in.  Just think: the woman of your dreams may be sitting in my office this afternoon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed she may.  _Frasier smiles, then turns and hurries out.  FADE OUT  Scene 2 - A Restaurant Fade in.  Frasier hurries up to the Maitre D', Georges._

speaker: Georges
text: Ah, Monsieur, so nice to see you again.  Your special table is ready for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: And the wine?

speaker: Georges
text: As you requested, monsieur.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  And the roses?

speaker: Georges
text: I'm so sorry, monsieur, I felt that the scent would distract from the wine's distinctive bouquet.

speaker: Frasier
text: You forgot them, didn't you?

speaker: Georges
text: Yes, forgive me.

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, Georges.  All right, send a busboy out to pick some wild flowers, please.

speaker: Georges
text: Very good sir.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Gee.  You kinda sprinted ahead of me, there.

speaker: Frasier
text: So sorry.  I just wanted to make sure that we could get a table.  Here, come and sit.

speaker: Charlotte
text: This place is kinda fancy for a working dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, after the rigors of your camping trip with Frank, I thought you deserved a little elegance.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Thank you. [_She gets her notebook._] So, good news: I met this great woman today.  How do you feel about dating someone a little taller than you?

speaker: Frasier
text: How much taller?

speaker: Charlotte
text: I don't know exactly, but I did have to turn off the ceiling fan.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's just put her in the maybe pile, shall we?

speaker: Frank
text: Hi, sweetie.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Hi.

speaker: Frank
text: Sorry to interrupt.  I know you're working.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frank, you know Frasier.

speaker: Frank
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, good to see you, Frank.

speaker: Frank
text: I just need the key to your apartment.  I left my blue field notebook there and I want to double-check some whale songs I copied down.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, sure.

speaker: Frank
text: We were in a boat all day, recording whale songs.  I think we may have had a really big interpretive breakthrough.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you should tell us about it sometime.

speaker: Frank
text: That's a great wine.  Can I steal a glass?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yeah, here. [_to Frasier_] You don't mind, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, not at all.  Although as the Irish say: "A man takes a drink, the drink takes a drink, the drink takes the man."

speaker: Frank
text: That's very good.  "As the old cock crows, the young cock learns."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, wasn't it O'Casey who once wrote: "The Irish treat a serious thing as a joke, and a joke as a serious thing."?

speaker: Charlotte
text: You'd really have to ask Frank about that.  He's the one who loves Irish literature.  He lent me an anthology, but I haven't made much of a dent in it.  I'm sorry, honey, I'm trying.

speaker: Frank
text: I know you are, baby. _He kisses her cheek as Georges brings a vase of wild flowers to the table._

speaker: Georges
text: Your flowers as requested, monsieur. [_noticing Frank_] I'm sorry, I thought you were to be deux.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well now we are trois.  Thank you, Georges, could you bring us another glass, please.

speaker: Georges
text: [_knowingly_] Yes, I understand, monsieur.  It is most sophisticated of you.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frasier, you ordered these flowers?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the table just looked so bare.

speaker: Frank
text: These are great choices, man.  These are Washington wild flowers, remember from our hike?  Foxglove, fine toothed penstemon, harsh paintbrush.  Ah, remember this one?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, it's on the tip of my tongue...

speaker: Frank
text: Monkey-flower.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Monkey-flower!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, often confused with the chimp-pansy.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frank made the same joke this morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Frank
text: Great minds.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.   _Update 2010/8/8: Thanks to William Melvin for transcribing the French conversation between Frasier and Jean-Pierre and also providing a literal translation, which differs from the subtitles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, seulement deux cartes, Georges; ce jeune homme va juste prendre un verre de vin.Just two menus, Georges. [subtitle: Ah, This fellow is only staying for a drink.] [literal: Ah, only two menus, Georges; this young man will just have a glass of wine.]

speaker: Frank
text: Non, je prendrai une carte.  On s'amuse bien.  Et a vous dire vrai, je meurs de faim. [subtitle: No, no.  I'll take a menu.  We're having fun. And to tell you the truth, I'm starving.] [literal: No, I'll take a menu.  We're all having fun. And to tell you the truth, I'm dying of hunger.]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, terrific.  _As Frasier glares at his menu in frustration, the word "Merde" appears in the subtitles._ [_N.B. Georges is meant to be French, but if you listen carefully you hear a hint of a Cockney accent._] _FADE TO:  Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Niles and Daphne are on the couch.  Martin opens the front door for Roz._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, how ya doin'?

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.  Hey, look at you, Mr. Handsome.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks. I'm gonna go hear Ronee sing at the Rendezvous.  And then afterwards I am going to give her her engagement ring.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Martin, it's beautiful.

speaker: Roz
text: She's gonna love this.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks.  I forgot I had it.  I bought it years ago for Sherry, but then we broke up.

speaker: Daphne
text: You can't give Ronee a used ring!

speaker: Martin
text: Sherry never touched it.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it doesn't matter.  Ronee deserves something you picked out just for her.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she'll think I picked this out just for her.

speaker: Daphne
text: But you didn't.

speaker: Martin
text: But she'll think I did.

speaker: Daphne
text: But you didn't.  You'll have to sell that and buy Ronee a new one.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, what's the difference?  Niles, come on, back me up here.

speaker: Niles
text: You can't be serious!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez.

speaker: Martin
text: Fine, back in the vault.

speaker: Daphne
text: Some vault.  It's an old cigar box with a bunch of silver dollars and Eddie's baby teeth.  [_N.B. See[[5.11]](/frasier/transcripts/season_5/episode_11/aint_nobodys_business_if_i_do.html "Ain't Nobody's Business If "I Do""), "Ain't Nobody's Business If �I Do.'"_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hey, Roz.  What are you doing here?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hi.  I was just shopping around the corner, thought I'd stop by.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, well unfortunately I have a date.

speaker: Roz
text: That's okay, I have one myself.  With Steve.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, your convict friend.  Do you think that's wise?

speaker: Roz
text: The man made one mistake.  Besides, I don't know any guy who's not a little fascinated by fire.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and a felon now knows where you live.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm not a total idiot.

speaker: Roz
text: Hello?  Oh, yeah, hi, Steve.  I'm grabbin' my coat, I'll be right down.

speaker: Niles
text: So, you have a date tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, actually Charlotte and I have been out three times this week.  We've been wine tasting, beach-combing, and we actually shared a blanket in a horse-drawn carriage.

speaker: Daphne
text: I take it Frank's off in the mountains again?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, he was there, too.

speaker: Martin
text: Let's go.

speaker: Niles
text: You mean, it's been the three of you all week?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not exactly how I wanted, but the more time I spend with them, the less time they spend alone together.

speaker: Daphne
text: It doesn't bother Frank, you tagging along on their dates?

speaker: Frasier
text: Frank?  No.  In fact, he's quite taken with me.  It doesn't even occur to him that I might be a rival.  Galling, yes, but it does give me more time to work my magic on Charlotte.

speaker: Frasier
text: In another week, you can kiss Frank goodbye. _The elevator opens to reveal Frank and Charlotte in a passionate embrace._

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe we'll wait until there's not a line.

speaker: Frank
text: Hi, guys.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Frank
text: Gangsta!

speaker: Frasier
text: What it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, uh, what's going on?  I thought we were meeting downtown.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I know, I'm sorry, but can we stay in tonight?  I've got to get up early and catch a flight to Chicago for some divorce stuff, and Frank's beat.

speaker: Frank
text: Yeah, I was at the beach all day cataloging the stomach contents of a dead elephant seal.  It was like all you can eat down at the Lobster Pot.  I'm sorry, the collapse of our coastal fisheries is no joke.  I'm just punchy.

speaker: Charlotte
text: We brought some movies.  We couldn't agree on which one to watch, so you break the tie. _She holds out the DVDs and Frasier sits on the coffee table to look at them._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm... "The Perfect Storm" or "When Harry Met Sally."  I guess I'm going to have to go for "When Harry Met Sally."

speaker: Frank
text: YES!  He'll have what I'm havin'!  _Frasier just shrugs with his "I can't win" expression.  FADE TO:_ **MENAGE A HUH?** _Scene 4 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Charlotte is waiting in the hallway.  When the elevator opens, Martin and Ronee get off.  They notice that Charlotte's hair is unkempt._

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, hi.  We keep passing each other.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  We got some dessert here, if you wanna stay.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, no thanks.  I've got to catch an early flight, but tell Frasier I'll call him?

speaker: Martin
text: Sure.  Bye.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Bye-bye.

speaker: Ronee
text: Do I know her?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, she's the woman Frasier's been after.  She has a boyfriend already, but maybe somethin' happened.

speaker: Ronee
text: I'll say.  You don't get that hair-style sitting up. _CUT TO: the living room as they come in and Martin turns on the light. Frasier is asleep on the couch, Frank is asleep and curled against his shoulder._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez!

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, so long as he's happy.  _FADE OUT  End of Act 1  Act 2_ **LORD OF THE RING** _Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  The doorbell rings and Martin answers.  It is Niles and Daphne._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi guys.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Daphne, Niles.  Listen, the opera tickets are right there by the phone.  Wish I could use them myself.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, if you'd gotten a third, you could take that couple you're dating.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's very droll.  Frank injured himself on our hike, so I've got Charlotte all to myself this evening.  I'm not going to waste this opportunity.  I'm going to make her a romantic dinner and then tell her how I feel about her.

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, really?

speaker: Niles
text: Are you sure she's ready for that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know, but I can't stand this ridiculous threesome anymore.  You know, the worst part is how completely unthreatening Frank finds me.  As if I'm some sort of a harem eunuch.

speaker: Daphne
text: How'd he hurt himself, anyway?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he strained his back carrying me over a brook.

speaker: Niles
text: You wounded him and you're stealing his woman in the same day?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I didn't ask the man to carry me!  He simply hoisted me over his shoulder before I could stop him.  That's not something you get used to, no matter how many times it happens.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't you worry about it.  You just do what you gotta do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Dad.  Wish me luck.  I'm making her beef bourguignon from a new recipe.

speaker: All
text: Good luck.

speaker: Niles
text: Flour the beef.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're looking very sharp.

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting up_] Oh, I got the new ring.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, let's have a look.

speaker: Martin
text: I sold the old one and got this new one this morning.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, it's huge.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's beautiful, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Ronee
text: Hi.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey.

speaker: Ronee
text: What's goin' on?

speaker: Martin
text: Nothin'.  Oh, you look lovely tonight.  But you know, I think your hand is kinda underdressed.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, my God!  Marty, it's gorgeous.  I love it and I love you, in that order.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, thank you.  Listen, I've got to go wash my hands.  I was eating Cheetos all the way over.

speaker: Martin
text: I love this lady.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, let's have a look.  Oh, it's brilliant.  Oh, you had it inscribed!

speaker: Martin
text: I did?

speaker: Niles
text: "Lil' Cupid.  Til Def Do Us Part."  What is that?

speaker: Martin
text: Let me see that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Isn't "Lil' Cupid" that obese rapper?   The one they arrested for drugs?

speaker: Niles
text: Where did you get this ring?

speaker: Martin
text: At an auction! [_off their looks_] A police auction.

speaker: Niles
text: You can't give that to her!

speaker: Martin
text: Well I can't take it back, she loves it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what are you going to tell her?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, just relax, I'll handle it.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, there's my lil' cupid.  All beautiful and clean.  All you need is a bow and arrow, Lil' Cupid.

speaker: Ronee
text: Why are you calling me that?

speaker: Martin
text: I always call you that.

speaker: Ronee
text: No, no you don't.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, uh, maybe I mostly say it when you're not around.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes.  It's always "Lil' Cupid said this." or "Lil' Cupid did that."

speaker: Daphne
text: It looks beautiful on you.

speaker: Ronee
text: Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, promise me you'll never take it off, Lil' Cupid.

speaker: Ronee
text: Okay, okay.  I promise if you'll stop calling me that.

speaker: Martin
text: Deal.

speaker: Ronee
text: I'm gonna go look at this in the mirror.

speaker: Daphne
text: How did you get it to fit her?  Lil' Cupid's as big as a house.

speaker: Martin
text: Keep your voice down.  It was a toe ring.  _He smugly sits back in his chair with a beer.  FADE TO:  Scene 2 - Charlotte's Apartment Fade in.  Charlotte is sitting at her table, Frasier comes in with two plates._

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are.  Beef bourguignon with sauteed fiddlehead ferns and walnut chutney.

speaker: Charlotte
text: It's exactly what I need after the day I've had.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe I could give you a neck rub while it cools.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh... oh, you're the best.  You know, I am so sorry you've had to put up with all this business with me and Frank.

speaker: Frasier
text: What business?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Well, you know, all this tension between us.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's tension?

speaker: Charlotte
text: He's a great guy, we just seem to be... I don't know...

speaker: Frasier
text: Fighting?  Growing apart?  Not clicking?

speaker: Frank
text: Darling.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, I'm sorry, it's my watch.  It's caught.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, got it? _She turns around in his arms, while he reaches up and tries to release her hair.  Frank comes in while they're in this compromising position._

speaker: Frank
text: Shoulda known.  The minute I'm laid up, you're over here making my lady dinner.  You're true blue, buddy.

speaker: Frank
text: Hi, baby.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Hello, Frank.

speaker: Frank
text: Mmm, walnut chutney, that's daring.

speaker: Frank
text: Were you giving her a back rub?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, was I?  Yes, I suppose I was, yes.

speaker: Frank
text: Would you mind doing me?  I took an aspirin after the hike, and my neck's still a little tight.

speaker: Frank
text: So, tell me all about Chicago.  How was it?

speaker: Charlotte
text: I'll tell you later.

speaker: Frank
text: Oh, that's nice.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frasier, stop rubbing his neck.  Sit down.

speaker: Frank
text: Why can't he rub my neck?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Because when you came in, we were just sitting down to dinner.  You could've called first.

speaker: Frank
text: Well, I didn't know I needed to get clearance.  Geez, you're as touchy as a hermit thrush.

speaker: Charlotte
text: This is typical of you.  You come in here, you expect me to change my plans because you're suddenly available.  It's insensitive.

speaker: Frank
text: Oh, I'M insensitive.  I've been tracking a pod of humpback whales for a week and they've been talking their asses off, but have you once asked me what Bonnie has to say?  Or Robert?  Or Grace?

speaker: Charlotte
text: They're WHALES!

speaker: Frank
text: They're my friends!

speaker: Charlotte
text: Stop yelling.  You're upsetting Frasier.

speaker: Frank
text: I didn't do anything.  I came in here, kissed you hello, and you jumped down my throat.  What the hell is your problem?

speaker: Charlotte
text: You are!  You are driving me crazy!

speaker: Frank
text: Do you believe her?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Don't you drag him into this!  Oh, you know what, I can't deal with this tonight.

speaker: Frank
text: Well, when can you deal with it?  I'll call ahead and make an appointment.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I think you should leave.

speaker: Frank
text: Fine!

speaker: Frank
text: Come on, Frasier, let's go. _He heads for the door while Charlotte heads for the bathroom. Frasier just looks confused._

speaker: Frank
text: Times like this, a guy really needs his buddy. _Giving up, Frasier tosses down his napkin and follows Frank out.  DISSOLVE TO: later. Charlotte is on the couch, slumped down and drinking wine. Frasier knocks on the door and comes in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi.  Just wanted to see how you're doing.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Tip-top.  How's your friend?

speaker: Frasier
text: He went someplace dark.  I couldn't follow.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Him and his moods.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, he climbed some kind of pine tree.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Look, I'm, I'm sorry about all that.  I think this is it for Frank and me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Charlotte
text: It's just not working.  I think I was always attracted to the idea of him more than him.

speaker: Frasier
text: This may seem inappropriate, but I'm not entirely sad to hear you say that.

speaker: Charlotte
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: I would think my feelings were obvious by now.  All the time we've been spending together.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I just thought it was because you were hitting it off with Frank.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you kidding?  The man smells like a chum boat.  You, you're the one I wanted to be with.  Look, uh, I realize you're in a vulnerable state and you probably need some time to process this, so I'll just, uh...

speaker: Charlotte
text: Don't go.  I've been thinking a little about you, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, God, I'm uncomfortable.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, I'm rushing things.

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, no, it's just I'm lying on a wine bottle.  _She puts it aside and they start kissing again.  FADE TO:  Scene 3 - Charlotte's Apartment Fade in.  Charlotte is in bed, rain can be heard outside. Frasier comes in with two mugs._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good morning.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, dear God, please tell me nothing happened last night.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I'm kidding!  I'm kidding! _Frasier, relieved, sits on the bed and gives her a kiss.  She takes one of the mugs._

speaker: Charlotte
text: I'm glad you stayed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me too.

speaker: Frank
text: Hey, guys.  You're in my robe.  Guess you got caught in the rain, too, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I did.

speaker: Frasier
text: What happened to your hand?

speaker: Frank
text: Ah, I was so mad last night, I punched a raccoon.  God, I'm a bastard.  You're a good guy to come check on her.  Never understand why women don't like you. [_to Charlotte_] Can we talk?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yeah, I think that's a good idea.

speaker: Frasier
text: My clothes should be dry by now. _He grabs them from the floor beside the bed and hurries to the bathroom.  Charlotte puts on her robe and Frank gets up._

speaker: Frank
text: So, what's goin' on with us?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, come on Frank.  I think you know it's not working.

speaker: Frank
text: Yeah.

speaker: Charlotte
text: And, anyway, there's something else you should know.  When I was in Chicago, my ex told me he's moving to New York. So, I bought the old business from him.  I'm moving back home.

speaker: Frank
text: You sure about this?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yeah.  I mean, I know Chicago, I have friends there. Seattle just hasn't panned out for me.  I thought you should be the first to know.

speaker: Frank
text: Well, I know you'll do great.

speaker: Charlotte
text: So will you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, I should be going.

speaker: Frank
text: That's okay.  You stay, I'm goin'.

speaker: Frank
text: You know this isn't your fault, right partner?  You be good, buddy.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know I should feel sad for Frank, but I can't help feeling happy.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frasier, I...

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, I'm late for about three things, so can I see you later this afternoon?  Maybe after my show?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Okay, after your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perfect.  Look, I hate to jinx this, but I'm so glad about what happened. _He kisses her again and leaves.  She slowly sits back down, a worried look on her face.  FADE OUT  End of Act 2_
